2164.subject: GS
2164.descrlong: Introduces students to core concepts of ecological political economy that focus on interrelationships between humans and nature in a non-heirarchial manner.  ecological political economy approach to planetary resources, their distribution, allocation, and concentration.  Considers perspectives on the global commons beyond the jurisdiction of nation-states, international agreements, and institutions. Analyzes alternative accounts of Northern ecological debt and Southern ecological credit.
